intro: Meniscium salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaved meniscium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable component of ecological habitats.
